feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Issue with Unit of Measure Mapping in Document and Report Compliance for Colombia (DIAN Requirements
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We are currently configuring Document and Report Compliance (DRC) for Colombia in an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition implementation, and we encountered an issue related to the Unit of Measure (UoM) mapping during electronic invoice generation.

While generating the invoice XML, the system retrieves the Unit_OF_Measure code from the value mapping configuration. However, we noticed that several standard SAP UoMs do not have a direct equivalent in the fiscal authority’s database (DIAN).

For example:

  • In S/4HANA Cloud, the unit “PI – Piece” exists and is commonly used in logistics and sales processes.

  • However, in the DIAN catalog, there is no unit of measure for “piece”, only options like DPC (Dozen Pieces) and other grouped units.

This creates a mismatch, since the SAP standard UoM does not appear in the official DIAN list, and therefore it is not clear how we should properly map these units to comply with DIAN’s required XML structure.

My questions are:

  1. How should we handle UoM mapping in DRC when the DIAN catalog does not include a direct equivalent for SAP standard units such as PI (Piece)?

  2. Is there an SAP-recommended approach or a standard mapping table for Colombia that aligns S/4HANA Cloud UoMs with DIAN-approved UoMs?

  3. Is it possible (or recommended) to create a custom mapping in Value Mapping for units not listed by DIAN, or must we adapt the business process to use only DIAN-supported units?

  4. Has anyone faced this issue in previous Colombian DRC implementations, and what was the accepted solution?

Any guidance or reference to official SAP notes or documentation for Colombia’s DRC unit-of-measure mapping would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: Change the remitter name (payer name / 振込元の依頼人名) only for a specific supplier
entry.content:
We have a requirement to change the remitter name (payer name / 振込元の依頼人名) only for a specific supplier in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

As far as we understand:

The remitter name is configured only at Company Code × Payment Method level via SSCUI 101044 – Set Up Payment Methods per Company Code.

We cannot find any SSCUI, Cloud BAdI, or Custom Logic that allows overriding the remitter name at vendor level.

Payment Medium Cloud BAdIs seem to allow only adding reference fields or changing file names, but not modifying the remitter/payer name in the payment file.

My questions:

1. Is there any supported way in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition to override the remitter name for a specific supplier (vendor-specific)?

2. If not, is creating a dedicated payment method (with a different remitter name) and assigning it only to that supplier considered the recommended workaround?

3. Has anyone implemented a similar requirement, or is this fully restricted due to Public Cloud limitations?

Any insights, confirmation, or SAP official references would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Employee Replication as Vendors in S/4 Public Cloud
entry.content:
I have a client who uses SuccessFactors and is currently transitioning from ECC to S/4 Public Cloud. Due to client requirements, we are leveraging scope ID JB1 to integrate SuccessFactors and S/4.

Today, my client does not maintain employee payment details in SuccessFactors and only maintains this data in ECC. They also use program RPRAPA00 which creates an SM35 batch job to handle the creation of employees as vendors. Given program RPRAPA00 is no longer available in S/4 Public Cloud, we would be unable to leverage what they do today. Also, since they do not maintain payment information in SuccessFactors, we are unable to leverage the standard functionality available as part of JB1.

With all that in mind, I am looking for assistance in solving two problems:

  1. How can we accomplish the initial replication of employees where they get created as vendors? I thought about plugging standard values for all records in the API but that would create issues with any future payments based on what is populated in the supplier master. 
  2. How can we load the legacy employee vendors from ECC with their bank/payment details and then link it to the BP created through the SuccessFactors integration?

entry.title: Connect SAP Business Application Studio (SAP BAS) and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - error 403
entry.content:
Hello everyone in the community.

I would like to mention that I want to recreate the example from the following blog: Work with SAPUI5 Adaptation Projects to Make Changes and Extend the Source Code of an Application Variant of an SAP Fiori Application in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

I have a connection to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition with a Test/100 Tenant, and I followed the steps indicated in the following blog: Connect SAP Business Application Studio (SAP BAS) and SAP S/4HANA Cloud ABAP Environment, but with several adjustments. On the other hand, I also relied on this note (2685335 - SAP Web IDE Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) to successfully create the destination.

Basically, the note indicates the following steps:

  1. Maintain platform subaccounts and SAP Web IDE permissions (I omitted this step/blog).
  2. Set up trust between identity authentication and SAP Cloud Platform subaccount (I omitted this step/blog).
  3. Create OAuth communication system and user (I executed this).
  4. Enable SAP Web IDE for S/4HANA system via OAuth (I executed this).

In summary, from my SAP BTP account, I managed to list all the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition applications, but when I select the Manage Credit Accounts application, it shows the following error: "Fetching base application inbounds failed: Request failed with status code 403".

I've attached a screenshot.

In my case, I have already assigned the developer roles, extensibility roles, and the roles to access Manage Credit Accounts, and I even created the permissions from the Communication Arrangements.

Screenshots of assigned roles

Screenshots of Communication Arrangements

Screenshots of Inbound/Outbound Users

Screenshot of the destination

Now, I would like to know what I am doing wrong and why I am getting the error: "Fetching base application inbounds failed: Request failed with status code 403"?. Another thing I would like to know is: what is the replacement for SAP_COM_0013 since it is obsolete?.However, I found that the 3-System Landscapes in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition has three tenants: Development system, Test system, and Production system. But I am connecting to the Test System Tenant, and apparently, from that instance, it is not possible to perform the Adaptation Project (Developer Extensibility), although it is possible to use "Adapt UI" and even use "Key User Extensibility", according to the following documentation.

I am even attaching a screenshot stating that to use Developer Extensibility (Adaptation Project), it is necessary to be in the Development System Tenant.

However, the company's architecture does not have two tenants; they do everything from the (Test/Dev - Prd) Tenant. So, could you please guide me on what I should do or how to proceed to overcome the error, or is it simply that due to the Tenant I have access to, it is not possible to create the Adaptation Project?

Thank you very much in advance.

entry.title: regarding Backorder Processing (BOP)
entry.content:
Hi Experts!

I have a question regarding Backorder Processing (BOP).

Please see the scenario below:

* **Inventory:** 3,000 kg
* **Sales Orders (SOs):**
* SO 1: 1,000 kg (**Credit Blocked**)
* SO 2: 1,000 kg (**Credit Blocked**)
* SO 3: 1,000 kg (**Credit Blocked**)

*Note: When SOs 1 through 3 were initially created, stock was unavailable, resulting in a **zero confirmed quantity** in VA03.*

When **BOP** is executed in this state, the log shows a **Credit Warning and Saved** status for SOs 1 through 3.
However, when checking the schedule lines in **VA03**, the confirmed quantity remains zero.
In contrast, the **Product Available Stock Inquiry App (F7884)** shows 3,000 kg as **Reserved** for future requirements.

The next day, when Sales Order 4 (1,000 kg) is created, it also fails to obtain a confirmed quantity.

We would like to understand the technical reason for this behavior: why is the stock internally reserved or consumed (preventing SO 4 from obtaining it), yet the confirmed quantity remains zero in VA03?

Best Regards,
S-O

entry.title: Enter Trading Partner in "Post Incoming Payments" App
entry.content:
We are getting an error "Enter Trading Partner" in the "Post Incoming Payments App.

This error is as expected because the G/L we are trying to post to requires a trading partner number according to the substitution and validation logic we configured.

When we open up the line item that has the respective G/L, we do not see the option to assign a trading partner number under the "account assignment" field.

Can you help us understand why Trading Partner field is not under line item 2 in this app? When we go into similar apps like "Post General Journal Entries" the Trading Partner field is in all line items under the "Account Assignment" field.

 

***REMOVED BY MODERATION ***


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Automation of foreign payments in SAP S/4HANA Could Public Edition
entry.content:
I have a few questions regarding setting up foreign payments via automatic payment in our S/H HANA Public cloud  system:

1. Does DMEE setup need to be done for foreign payments? If so, could you please guide me on how to do this and where to start?
2. The house bank and bank account have been assigned to the supplier master data with the local currency (AUD). Could you please advise on how we can proceed with foreign payments in this scenario?
3. Where can we complete the customization settings for foreign payments?
